meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily fatigued.
meanings.sent1: Her fatigability was evident after just a short walk.
meanings.sent2: His fatigability increased as the day went on.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fatigability was amusing to watch as it tried to catch the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The old car showed signs of fatigability as it struggled to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The fatigability of the marathon runner was so extreme that he collapsed at the finish line.

meanings.definition: The susceptibility to becoming tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: The child's fatigability was noticeable after a long day of playing.
meanings.sent2: The fatigability of the elderly man made it difficult for him to complete his daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The fatigability of the phone battery was amusingly timed to die right before an important call.
meanings.sent4: The fatigability of the team's defense was like a leaky dam, letting in goals easily.
meanings.sent5: The fatigability of the flashlight's batteries was so rapid that it needed replacement often.
